meanings.definition: A person or thing that affixes something.
meanings.sent1: The affixer carefully placed the stamp on the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The office affixer is responsible for attaching labels to the files.
meanings.sent3: The little robot affixer kept sticking stickers on everything it could find.
meanings.sent4: She was like an affixer of smiles, always brightening up people's days.
meanings.sent5: The affixer, a helpful tool, made sure everything stayed in place.

meanings.definition: A device used to attach or fasten something.
meanings.sent1: The affixer on the machine securely seals the packages.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use the proper affixer to connect the pieces together.
meanings.sent3: The magical affixer could stick things together with just a touch.
meanings.sent4: The affixer worked like a charm, binding the pages effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: With a click, the affixer locked the door in place.

meanings.definition: To attach or fasten something to something else.
meanings.sent1: She will affixer the poster to the wall using tape.
meanings.sent2: Remember to affixer the stamp securely to the envelope.
meanings.sent3: He tried to affixer the balloon to the ceiling, but it kept floating away.
meanings.sent4: Love can affixer hearts together in a special bond.
meanings.sent5: The glue will affixer the pieces in place for the art project.
